business.headline: Accenture guidance boost lifts Infosys, Wipro; IT stocks rally up to 4%Accenture not only exceeded market expectations for its Q4 results but also raised its revenue guidance for FY25 to a range of 3-6%.

Isha, Akash Ambani among top young entrepreneurs in Hurun's under-35 listThe Hurun list celebrates 150 entrepreneurs aged 35 or younger from across India, marking their achievements in fields ranging from retail to tech startups.
Sensex, Nifty hit record high for 6th straight sessionThe S&P BSE Sensex added 67.47 points to 85,903.59, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 14.70 points to 26,230.75.

Swiggy files for IPO, aims to raise about Rs 3,750 croreSwiggy, backed by investment group Prosus and Japan's SoftBank, competes with Zomato in India's online restaurant and cafe food deliveries sector.

Will Middle East conflict dampen Dalal Street's rally? Here's what experts say Despite the uncertainty arising from the Middle East conflict, Indian stocks have surged, with benchmarks like the Sensex and Nifty showing strong gains.

Vedanta shares cross Rs 500 mark after gaining 5%. More gains ahead?Vedanta's performance in 2024 has been impressive, with the stock climbing 95% so far this year and gaining 124.35% over the last 12 months. Over a five-year period, the stock has risen by 202%.
Sensex, Nifty close at all-time high led by rally in auto and metal stocksThe S&P BSE Sensex added 666.25 points to end at 85,836.12, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 211.90 points to close at 26,216.05.
Tata Steel shares gain for 5th straight session. What should investors do?In the past year, Tata Steel has rallied 28%, with an 18% gain so far in 2024.

Trent shares surge to record high on Citi's 'buy' call. Check detailsCiti set a target price of Rs 9,250 for the stock, signaling a 21% upside from the previous closing price, and added it to its Pan-Asia high-conviction focus list.

Puneet Chhatwal eyes top 3 spot for Taj Hotels in global hospitalityHe envisions the brand securing its place among the top three global hospitality companies in the next five years, a goal driven by Taj's ethos of service, adaptability to changing luxury trends, and a commitment to sustainable growth.

80% of your portfolio should be 'Dal-Chawal': Radhika Gupta's investment mantraRadhika Gupta's message focused on the importance of disciplined, long-term investing—what she calls "Dal-Chawal Investing"—a simple and sustainable approach she believes will help investors navigate the market's highs and lows.

Diffusion Engineers IPO opens for subscription: Should you subcribe?The price band for the IPO has been set between Rs 159 and Rs 168 per share. Investors can apply for a minimum lot of 88 shares, requiring a retail investment of Rs 14,784.
Manba Finance IPO allotment: Check status, expected listing gain, subscriptionManba Finance IPO opened for subscription on September 23 and ran until September 25, generating huge bids.

Hyundai Motors IPO: Can it beat Maruti Suzuki's market valuation?Hyundai, the second-largest automaker in India, has maintained a steady market share of 15-17% since 2008. But does it have what it takes to beat market leader Maruti Suzuki's valuation?

Gold, silver price today, September 26, 2024: Yellow metal records dip, silver trades higher on MCXGold Price Today 26 September 2024: Gold is trading on the lower side while silver rates have recorded a hike on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Thursday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.
Sensex, Nifty hit record high as rally extends for 5th straight sessionThe S&P BSE Sensex rose to an all-time high of 85,333.23 in early trade, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed to 26,056.

Hyundai to Swiggy: 5 big IPOs set to light up Dalal Street before 2024 endsFrom Hyundai Motors' massive offering to Swiggy's much-anticipated debut, the year's final IPOs could be the most exciting ones yet.

Sensex, Nifty hit record high as power and financial stock drive market rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex added 255.83 points to end at 85,169.87, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 63.75 points to close at 26,004.15.

PNB, SBI, UCO: JM Financial lists 11 PSU bank stocks worth buying after selloffSince reaching its 52-week high, the PSU Bank index has dropped by 15%, with banks like UCO Bank, Bank of India (BOI), Indian Overseas Bank (IOB), and Union Bank of India seeing sharper declines of 25-30%.

Easy Trip Planners shares plunge 20% to record low. Here's what happenedThe steep decline in share price was triggered by news that promoter Nishant Pitti plans to sell 15 crore shares, representing 8.5% of the company's total share capital, in a block deal.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: India's bid for permanent UN Security Council seat gets major push UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer on Thursday backed India for a permanent member of the United Nations Security Council (UNSC) during his address at the United Nations General Assembly's 79th session in New York.

Bangladesh's Muhammad Yunus reveals 'brains' behind Sheikh Hasina's ousterSpeaking at the Clinton Global Initiative, Dr Muhammad Yunus introduced and praised the young leaders who drove the student-led movement that led to Sheikh Hasina's ouster.

Class 2 student killed at UP hostel to bring 'glory, fame' to schoolThe alleged motive behind the murder was to ensure the prosperity of the school, which had been under financial strain. The accused believed that offering a human sacrifice would lead to the school's success.

Hezbollah drone chief killed as Netanyahu vows to strike Lebanon with full forceIsraeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu reiterated that Israel will continue its "full force" strikes against Hezbollah, dampening hopes for a proposed 21-day ceasefire advocated by US and European officials.

Man throws acid on wife's face after she discovers his affair, asks for divorceThe couple had a love marriage in 2019, and soon after, the woman learnt about her husband's unemployment, drug addiction and extramarital affair.

Devara X review: Fans 'blown away' by Jr NTR's performance, but disappointed by VFXJr NTR's Devara: Part 1 made its grand theatrical debut on September 27. While the superstar's performance is being praised on social media, the VFX used in the film drew flak.

Nitin Gadkari clears air around Opposition's PM offer: Not my ambitionNitin Gadkari dismissed ambitions of holding the Prime Minister post, asserting his commitment to current duties and reaffirming loyalty to the BJP amid speculation of opposition offers.

Saif Ali Khan calls Adipurush controversy 'unsettling': Not here to make troubleSaif Ali Khan discussed the Adipurush controversy at the India Today Conclave 2024, calling the legal issues 'unsettling'. He emphasised the need for caution regarding sensitive topics like religion.

Iran never forgets those who...: Vice President on arming Russia in Ukraine warMohammad Javad Zarif, in an interview with CNN, stressed that Iran's supply of weapons to Russia in the Ukraine war was more of a business to 'earn currency'.

RG Kar hangs heavy on Durga Puja 2024, Bengalis debate to celebrate or notDurga Puja is not just a festival but an emotion for all Bengalis, but this year, people feel a strange hesitation to celebrate it. With Kolkata being the ground zero of a heinous rape and murder, here's how the community is prepping for the upcoming festivities.
Shopping, iPhones: Law student resorts to theft to fulfill girlfriend's demandsIn Lucknow, a law student resorted to theft to meet his girlfriend's expensive demands, leading to his arrest.
Named after Lord Shiva: All about India's Param Rudra SupercomputerParam Rudra is a high-performance computing system designed to handle complex calculations and simulations at remarkable speeds.

Another blow to ex-Andhra Chief Minister Jagan Reddy, 3rd YSR Congress MP quitsYSR Congress Party MP Ryaga Krishnaiah resigned from his Rajya Sabha seat, with Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankar accepting his resignation immediately. Krishnaiah is the third leader of the party to step down.

Decoding Jr NTR's rise beyond a regular film star to a legit people's heroTelugu actor Jr NTR's much-awaited film Devara: Part 1 hit theatres today. As the film made its grand theatrical debut, let's decode how the actor became the global icon that he is today.

ED raids premises linked to Telangana minister and others in money laundering caseThe Enforcement Directorate conducted raids as part of an ongoing probe into a money laundering case involving an alleged smuggling operation exceeding Rs 100 crore.

Polls to Delhi civic body's key panel today after AAP, Lt Governor face-offThe Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) is set to conduct the highly contentious election for the sixth seat on its Standing Committee today following a political standoff between the AAP and Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena.

UP Revenue Council mandates new dress code for employees: White shirt, blazers The decision was communicated by Sunil Kumar Jha, the special officer of the council, who emphasised the importance of this new policy to all divisional commissioners and district magistrates.

Binny and Family review: Debutante Anjini Dhawan is impressive, plot not so muchReleased-Fri Sep 27, 2024Binny and Family explores the generational gap through the lens of Binny, a girl balancing her modern life with her traditional family's expectations. While beautifully shot and featuring strong performances by Pankaj Kapur and Anjini Dhawan, it suffers from clichés and fatigue.

IPL 2025: Dwayne Bravo appointed new KKR mentor, replaces Gautam GambhirIPL 2025: Kolkata Knight Riders announced former West Indies all-rounder Dwayne Bravo as their mentor for the upcoming Indian Premier League season. Bravo's association with Chennai Super Kings, therefore, comes to an end.

Andhra government forms 9-member team to probe animal fat in Tirupati laddusThe SIT will be led by Guntur Range Inspector General of Police, Sarvashresth Tripathi. The SIT will also probe the other irregularities that reportedly took place during the previous YSR Congress party's regime in Tirumala.

sports.headline: Watch: Virat Kohli's feet touched by Kanpur ground staff member before 2nd TestA member of the Green Park ground staff decided to approach Virat Kohli and proceeded to touch Virat Kohli's feet in a heartwarming moment on Friday, September 27. Kohli is aiming to make an impact in the Kanpur Test.

India become first team to win toss and bowl first in Kanpur Test in 60 years India vs Bangladesh, 2nd Test: Rohit Sharma called it right at the toss and opted to field at Green Park. This is the first time in 60 years that a team has won the toss in Kanpur and opted to bowl.

Bravo's final appearance was cut short by an injury during the 2024 Caribbean Premier League.

Bangladesh cricket enters new era as Shakib retires from Tests, T20IsIND vs BAN: Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan announced his retirement from T20Is and Tests. He put forth his decision prior to the Tigers' second Test against India, starting September 27 at the Green Park in Kanpur.

2nd Test: Chandimal 116, Kamindu world record help  Sri Lanka dominate Day 1Sri Lanka vs New Zealand, 2nd Test: Sri Lanka dominated the opening day in Galle, riding on Dinesh Chandimal's hundred and solid fifties from Angelo Mathews and Kamindu Mendis. Sri Lanka are leading the 2-match series 1-0.

Manu Bhaker recalls scooter accident a year before Paris Olympics  Manu Bhaker said that she had an accident last year in Paris while driving a scooter. Manu recently won two bronze medals in shooting for India in the Paris Olympics 2024.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
